creator: paul.chapman@elata.com
text:
My servlet loads an RMI object of type 'foo' which implements interface 'bar'.
If the stub class 'foo_Stub.class' is on tomcat's classpath then it works OK.
If I remove 'foo_Stub.class' from the classpath I get a ClassCastException when
I cast the stub to 'bar'.
On further inspection this happens because the rmi class loader loads the
class 'foo_Stub.class' and 'bar.class' even though 'bar.class' is on the
classpath. This means I have two versions of 'bar.class' loaded by different
class loaders (system and rmi) and I cannot cast between the two.
Should not the rmi class loader check if 'bar.class' is already loaded before
it goes ahead and loads it ?

creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
text:
Should be fixed in 3.3, if you use either the common classpath or only the 
webapp ( the later is prefered, for portability - you shouldn't put anything on the classpath, the webapp should be selfcontained )
